name: Ring-tailed Lemur
description: The Ring-tailed Lemur is a social primate with a distinctive black-and-white striped tail.
food_note: Forages in groups, often sunbathing in the morning.
proportions: Length: 40-50 cm, tail: 60 cm, weight: 2-3.5 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 4.5 months, one infant born, twins rare.
attractions: Popular in zoos for their playful behavior and striking appearance.
projects_note: Endangered due to habitat loss; conservation programs are active.
breeding: Commonly bred in captivity for conservation.
